column4: Hello all.  Does anyone happen to know a trick for getting wireless working on a dell Latitude d600? i've never had wireless problems with Ubuntu, so honestly i'm not sure what to do.
I'm running 11.04
are you on it roght now?
please plug in the cat5 cable to the d600
do a dmesg | grep b43 see any errors
also check rfkill list all
any errors on the dmesg | grep b43
any errors on the dmesg | grep b43|/wl ?
it's telling me ERROR: you must go to *weblink* and download the correct firmware.  I thought the "Additional Drivers" took care of that kind of thing.
rfkill list all any thing blocked ?
nothing is blocked
you need to re-install the firmware-b43-installer
see http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1748245&page=5     post #44
Well I tried installing firmware-b43legacy-installer, but some subprocess installed postinstallation script returned error exit status 1.
reboot try again
looking at the details, it shows "Not supported card here (blah blah) Use b43 firmware. This is just for the b43legacy driver. Aborting.
take your time and read it all (the link )
meh, I seem to be going backwards.  Now the wireless option has vanished from the network indicator.
is the dmesg error gone is rfkill list all     anything blocked
the dmesg doesn't seem to do anything now.
what about rfkill list all
go back to the therad and post lsmod and dmesg
Thanks for taking the time.
been there got a d610 sitting next to me also
